questions.question: Which term describes the act of opposing modifications to the status quo?
What does it mean to 'future-proof' a business?
options: To look at historical data only
To make a business resistant to future changes
To design a business to continue being useful in the future
questions.answer: To design a business to continue being useful in the future

questions.question: Identify the correct conditional linker: 'The merger will go ahead ______ the regulatory body objects.'
Choose the most formal option: 'The contract is valid ______ that all parties sign by midnight.'
What is a 'Change Agent'?
options: A travel agent specializing in corporate trips
A person who resists any form of modification
An individual who acts as a catalyst for transformation
questions.answer: An individual who acts as a catalyst for transformation

questions.question: We will continue to invest in R&D ______ (as / so) long as the results are promising.
______ (Provided / Unless) that we get the permit, construction will start next month.
Which of these emphasizes the strictness of a condition?
What is 'Disruptive Innovation'?
options: Innovation that follows existing market trends
Innovation that creates a new market and displaces leaders
Innovation that causes frequent power outages
A minor update to a product
questions.answer: Innovation that creates a new market and displaces leaders
